article.description: Jalen Rose scored eight of his 25 points in the fourth quarter as the Indiana Pacers rallied in the final two minutes to beat the Utah Jazz 100-97 on Saturday night.

related.description: Sure, Karl Malone wishes the Utah Jazz could do something to upgrade their roster. But the Mailman says he expects to finish his career with the Jazz.
related.linkText: Malone shrugs off rumors, says he's staying put in Utah
related.title: Malone says he expects to finish career with Jazz
related.headline: Malone says he expects to finish career with Jazz

related.description: Utah Jazz forward Donyell Marshall didn't dress for Saturday night's game against Indiana and coach Jerry Sloan moved Russian rookie Andrei Kirilenko into the starting lineup.
related.linkText: Jazz blues: Marshall out with pulled groin injury
related.title: Jazz to start rookie Kirilenko
related.headline: Jazz to start rookie Kirilenko

related.description: Travis Best has recovered from a strained right hamstring and will be available Saturday night against the Utah Jazz.
related.linkText: Pacers activate Best off injured list
related.title: Best available for tonight's Jazz game
related.headline: Best available for tonight's Jazz game

article.headline: Stockton becomes NBA's all-time steals leader in loss
article.linkText: Rose leads Pacers' late rally in Utah
article.story:
SALT LAKE CITY (AP) -- Reggie Miller and Jalen Rose brought the Indiana Pacers back in the closing minutes, and the Utah Jazz were victimized again. Rose scored eight of his 25 points in the fourth quarter, when Miller scored seven of his 18, as Indiana rallied in the final two minutes to beat Utah 100-97 on Saturday night. There were 18 lead changes, 15 ties and neither team led by more than six points. It was close down the stretch, but the Pacers pulled ahead at 99-97 with 27.4 seconds remaining on a short flip by Jermaine O'Neal. "We were behind the 8-ball, it seems, the whole game," Miller said. "Every time we got a little lead, they came back. They came back again down the stretch and took the lead, but we kept coming back." There have been some lopsided defeats, but the Jazz have been close before coming up short in six of their 11 losses. "How frustrating is it to know that you're in the game and you lose in the end," said Karl Malone, who scored 18. "It's tough, but I guess if winning was easy everyone would be doing it." Rose made it interesting, going to the foul line with 5.8 seconds remaining. He hit the first but missed the second, and that gave Utah a final chance with 5.5 seconds to go. The Jazz worked the ball to John Stockton, who tossed up a prayer that hit the rim and bounced away. "We knew they would be going for a 3-pointer and the obvious guy to shoot is was John Stockton," Rose said. "We just wanted to put a hand up. I've seen him make a ton of those shots but today he came up a little long." On the previous possession, Stockton was upset because no foul was called when Jamaal Tinsley appeared to push him on a missed layup. "Sure, I would have liked to have had that call, but it didn't happen, so I'll move on," Stockton said. Stockton's two free throws helped Utah to a 95-92 lead with 1:55 to go, but Miller hit a 3-pointer that tied it with 1:34 to play. After a basket by Malone, Miller added two free throws with 1:03 on the clock to tie it at 97. O'Neal finished with 15 points and 12 rebounds, while Al Harrington had 12 points. Travis Best returned after two weeks on the injured list with a strained right hamstring, scoring 12 points in 22 minutes. Stockton, John Starks and Russian rookie Andrei Kirilenko, who started because Donyell Marshall has a pulled groin, each scored 13. Greg Ostertag, coming off the bench behind rookie Jarron Collins, had 12 points and 13 rebounds. With 9:30 to play in the third quarter, Stockton got the 3,000th steal of his 18-year career. He is the NBA's career leader in steals and assists, well ahead of second-place Michael Jordan (2,335). "I'm just out there playing," Stockton said. "Numbers are fun for you guys. It gives you something to talk about, but it doesn't really mean anything when you're out there playing." Utah lost for the fifth time in the last seven games, but the Jazz played with much more enthusiasm than they managed in a 98-76 blowout loss the previous night in Phoenix. "Regardless of their record, Utah is a very good team and they're always going to play well in this building," Rose said. "We knew it wasn't going to be a blowout."

Game notes
Marshall is listed as day-to-day. ... O'Neal's first-half line: 2-of-8 from the floor, 1-of-8 from the stripe, seven rebounds, three fouls. ... Ostertag got a big cheer when he swished two free throws late in the third. ... The Jazz have won 13 of the last 18 against the Pacers. ... Pacers coach Isiah Thomas and Malone shared a few words and a handshake before leaving the court for the dressing room.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
